page.title: 10MURTON A CARING COMMUNITY
page.content: Originally all Murtons residents depended on its mine to live,it was a close knit community. Today,it basically remains an insular community although its dependence on the mine is in decline as is the mine itself. People in Murton now are not necessarlly from mining backgrounds. The old community spirit does not come through anymore,people are too busy getting on with their own lives. However,they are quick to respond to charity appeals. Two major charities thrive in our village /{SAVE THE CHILDREN FUND}and{ {CHRISTIAN AID.}They are very well supported in all their activities and all their annual incomes amount to over Â£3000 between them /quite a respectable amount from a population most of whom are working class and not
